description:
In this presentation you will learn about:

-  The ``concurrent.futures`` API of Python 3
-  Threads vs forked processes vs spawned processes (pros and cons)
-  The impact of the GIL on CPU-bound Python programs
-  Bad interactions of fork-based multiprocessing and OpenMP runtimes
-  BLAS-based parallelism (e.g. MKL, OpenBLAS)
-  Memory bandwidth bound operations, arithmetic intensity and the
   roofline model.

This talk will include non-representative micro-benchmarks and silly
quizzes for the audience :)

We will also quickly introduce the
`loky <https://github.com/tomMoral/loky/>`__ project to help mitigate
some of the problems.
title: Tricks for Efficient Multicore Computing
